titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank Kellogg Smith Travel Photographs and Memorabilia
Smith (Frank Kellogg) Travel Photographs and Memorabilia
titlestmt.author: by Matthew D. Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:10

did.unittitle: Frank Kellogg Smith travel photographs and memorabilia.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of photograph albums, loose photographs, and memorabilia compiled by Frank Kellogg Smith that document his travels, predominately in western and central Europe, southern and eastern Africa, and the southern Pacific region, primarily from 1898-1922. Locations in Europe include Azerbaijan, Belgium, Channel Islands, France, Georgia, Great Britain (consisting of trips to England and Scotland), Hungary, Malta, Netherlands, Romania, Russia, Switzerland, and Ukraine. Locations in Africa include Egypt, Kenya, Madeira Islands, Mozambique, Rhodesia (Zambia and Zimbabwe), Somalia, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda, Yemen, and Zanzibar, as well as Victoria Falls and the Nile River. Locations in the Pacific include Australia, Canada, Fiji, Hawaii, New Zealand, Samoa, and the United States of America, which consist of views in Arizona, California, and New Mexico.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Bonnie F. Young and A David Young, Jr., 2006.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Frank Kellogg Smith Travel Photographs and Memorabilia is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frank Kellogg Smith Travel Photographs and Memorabilia. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biography of Frank Kellogg Smith
bioghist.p: Frank Kellogg Smith was born in Elizabeth, New Jersey, on April 15, 1873. His parents were Walter O. Smith (b. 1843) and Henrietta "Nettie" Wells Smith (b. 1848). In 1900 he was employed as a clerk, but by 1911 he was the representative for the United States Steel Corporation in South Africa. Smith later worked for the Standard Oil Company of New York. His residences in the United States included homes in Bronxville and New York City, New York, and Ivoryton, Connecticut. Smith married Isabelle Cleveland Kelsey on July 11, 1911; she died on February 12, 1943, in Ivoryton, Connecticut. He then married Sarah Anneke Van Ellendorf Lancraft on August 24, 1965. Smith was a member and president of the Circumnavigators Club, an organization devoted to bringing together those men and women who have circumnavigated the globe. Smith died in November 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photograph albums, loose photographs, and memorabilia compiled by Frank Kellogg Smith of his travels, predominately in western and central Europe, southern and eastern Africa, and the southern Pacific region, primarily from 1898-1922, with additional materials to circa 1889-1959. Strengths of the collection include photographic documentation at the turn of the twentieth century of localities and peoples in southern and eastern Africa, as well as southeastern Europe.
Titles to the albums come from imprinted titles or manuscript inscriptions by Smith.

Several images are duplicated in photographic prints in different albums, especially those albums documenting trips in Africa. Albums in boxes 14-18 primarily possess photographic prints that duplicate images in the albums in boxes 1-13.
Many of the photographic prints are accompanied by manuscript captions in the negative or in the albums.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Photograph albums in the collection are arranged chronologically, followed by loose photographic materials, which includes photographs by Smith and others, and then by memorabilia, which includes artwork, maps, papers, and then by oversize materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Albums arranged roughly chronologically. Most photographic prints mounted in the albums possess captions in the negatives or manuscript captions on the leaves.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 147 photographic prints)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Photographic prints mounted in the album. Many of the photographic prints have captions in the negatives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions in France and Scotland in June-July 1898; England, Belgium, France, and Switzerland, in July-September 1899; the Exposition Universelle in Paris, France, in June 1900; Switzerland in November 1900; the Netherlands in June 1901; Belgium in August 1902; and France in June 1907.

Images of particular interest include an informal portrait of King Oscar II of Sweden in Paris in June-July 1898, as well as informal portraits of Frederick VIII of Denmark, Émile François Loubet, and Georges Clemenceau, in June 1907.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 217 photographic prints)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Many of the photographic prints documenting the trip to New Zealand are missing from the album pages, and are in Box 19, folder 9.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs from an excursion in New Zealand, ca. 1900, and excursions in England, April-June 1898, September-October 1898, May 1899, and September 1899. Many of the photographic prints documenting the trip to New Zealand are missing from the album pages. There are also several views of Sark, Channel Islands.
Images of particular interest include views of Richmond, England, which includes views of a horse show and the vicinity.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 151 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs from two excursions; one excursion that included Hungary, Romania, Ukraine, Georgia, Russia, and Azerbaijan, March 1900-September 1900; the other excursion included Italy and the Vatican City, May1907-June 1907.
Images of particular interest document petroleum extraction in the localities of Gura Ocniţei and Târgovişte, Romania, and in Baku and Balachany, Azerbaijan.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 272 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs from excursions in South Africa from disparate dates including January 1903, August 1904, September to October 1910, August 1911, and February 1912. Several photographs include informal portraits of white and black Africans, including images of latter individuals performing native dances. Several incidental images show views of streets of Funchal, Madeira Island, in August 1902, September 1910, and August 1911.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 220 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions in South Africa in March-April 1903 and August 1906, as well as an undated excursion.
Several photographs include informal portraits of white and black Africans, including images of latter individuals performing native dances, as well as several images of Chinese immigrants.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 279 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs from three excursions; the first excursion journeyed from South Africa into Rhodesia (Zambia and Zimbabwe), May 1906; the second excursion journeyed from Mozambique, through Zanzibar, Kenya, and Yemen, April 1907 to May 1907, and the third from Kenya to Uganda, December 1910. Several photographs include informal portraits of white and black Africans, including images of latter individuals performing native dances.

did.physdesc: (Clothbound album, 24.8 X 36.3 cm, containing 354 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions to and in Africa, including South Africa, Rhodesia (Zambia and Zimbabwe), Mozambique, Tanzania, and Zanzibar, circa Sep-Dec 1910. The album probably documents a trip by Smith and his first wife, Isabelle Kelsey, prior to their marriage. The album also includes maps of Africa and Victoria Falls. Many of the photographic prints are also hand-colored.

did.physdesc: (Clothbound album, 24.8 X 36.3 cm, containing 420 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions to and in Africa, including South Africa, Rhodesia (Zambia and Zimbabwe), Mozambique, Tanzania, Zanzibar, Kenya, Yemen, Somalia, Egypt, Malta, France, England, and the United States, circa Sep-Dec 1910. The album probably documents a trip by Smith and his first wife, Isabelle Kelsey, prior to their marriage. The album also includes maps of Africa, Victoria Falls, and the Nile River. Many of the photographic prints are also hand-colored.

did.physdesc: (Clothbound album, 24.8 X 36.3 cm, containing 358 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions in Africa including locations in Zanzibar, Kenya, Uganda, and Egypt, circa Sep-Dec 1910. The album probably documents a trip by Smith and his first wife, Isabelle Kelsey, prior to their marriage. The album also includes a map of Africa. Many of the photographic prints are also hand-colored.

did.physdesc: (Clothbound album, 24.8 X 36.3 cm, containing 401 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions to and in Africa, including Egypt, Malta, England, South Africa, Mozambique, Zanzibar, Kenya, and the Madeira Islands, circa Sep-Dec 1910. The album probably documents a trip by Smith and his first wife, Isabelle Kelsey, prior to their marriage. The album also includes two maps of the Nile River. Many of the photographic prints are also hand-colored.

did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 274 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions in Australia in April 1912, September 1912-January 1913, March 1913, December 1914, May 1915, August 1915, and March 1916. Many photographic prints are loose in the album. Several images include views of sunbathers in water and shoreline. There are also images of wildlife including koala bears and a Kookaburra birds.

did.physdesc: (Clothbound album, 24.8 X 36.3 cm, containing 367 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions in the Pacific region, including Canada, Fiji, Australia, American Samoa, Hawaii, California, Arizona, and New Mexico, November 1912-March 1913. Many of the photographic prints are also hand-colored.

did.unittitle: South Pacific, United States, North Atlantic
did.physdesc: (Leatherbound album, 28.2 X 41.0 cm, containing 276 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document excursions in Vermont in September 1913; California and New Mexico in January 1914; California and Arizona in May 1916; New York in September 1919; New York in February 1920; and Virginia and Washington, D.C., in April 1922, as well as undated locations in Connecticut, Hawaii, and Samoa.

did.physdesc: (Cloth-bound album, 26.1 X 20.8 cm, containing 144 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs of trips to England in May-June 1897, October 1897, and April 1898, including an excursion to the Channel Islands, as well as photographs from undated excursions to France. There are also incidental undated images of Scotland.

did.physdesc: (Cloth-bound album, 26.1 X 20.8 cm, containing 96 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document numerous excursions including England in April-June 1898, and France and Scotland in June-July 1898.

did.physdesc: (Cloth-bound album, 26.1 X 20.8 cm, containing 78 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document locations primarily in England, September-October 1898, May-September 1899, and April 1900, as well as incidental images of Ukraine in April 1900, France in June 1900, Belgium in August and December 1900, and the Funchal, Madeira Island in August 1902.

did.physdesc: (Leather-bound album, 26.1 X 20.8 cm, containing 95 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document numerous excursions including: France and Switzerland in July-September 1899; Georgia in March 1900; Hungary, Romania, Ukraine, and Switzerland in September to November 1900; and undated discrete views of Chamonix-Mont-Blanc, France, and the Caucasus Mountain region.

did.physdesc: (Leather-bound album, 26.1 X 20.8 cm, containing 98 photographic prints)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs that document numerous excursions including: Ukraine, Russia, and Azerbaijan, April 1900; Netherlands and Belgium, June-July 1901; Netherlands, July-August 1902; and South Africa, June-August 1904.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Photographic prints are arranged alphabetically by geographic location.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Loose photographic prints created by Frank Kellogg Smith that accompanied the photograph albums.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Each folder contains a single photographic print, except where two or more photographic prints are noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of Manly Beach, Sydney

India, including Agra, Delhi, and Kolkata

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by surname of photographer or name of photography studio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographic prints collected by Smith from professional and amateur photographers and photographic studios.
